title: The parables of the hidden treasure and the Pearl as guides for the mission of the Christian church.
description:
A few new thoughts to bounce around Paul VanderKlay’s third hemisphere. 

Relevant and referenced videos:

Mark Galli: Neo-evangelical traitor - Paul VanderKlay
https://youtu.be/pOglf9uGJ2E

High masculine status doesn’t give women what it gives men - Paul VanderKlay
https://youtu.be/rWAEq7TInO0

Shadow Matriarchy & euphemism pt 3 - Grizwald Grim
https://youtu.be/1YaaFLx9EW0

Why can’t the Christian reformed church just stop fighting about same sex marriage? - Paul VanderKlay
https://youtu.be/SuRl-smHdSc



Using Matthew 13:44-46 as a metaphor, I ask six questions about the way the church is interacting with the world and culture. 

Here are the six questions I am pondering in this video:

1. What does the church present to the world, a low barrier to entry with a hidden value? Or high visible value with a high barrier to entry?

2. How can the church deal with its own sexual immorality problems so that it can be a meaningful voice on these subjects in the larger cultural conversation?

3. How can the church define their sexual ethics in such a way that it becomes a positive and viable alternative to the narrative that the world is selling, without compromising the sacred and holy nature of our message?

4. How can the church highlight the culture’s refusal to examine its role in causing the sexual dissatisfaction that is happening at large? Is there an opportunity for the church to offer a comprehensive solution, instead of always reacting to multiple different things?

5. How can the church learn to define its own terms instead of using the definitions of the culture at large? 

6. Can the church anticipate a crisis and define its stance before it arises?
